content.p: "Action" means any civil action or proceeding brought to seek\njudicial review of an action of the state as defined in subdivision

of this section, including an appellate proceeding, but does not include
an action brought in the court of claims.

"Fees and other expenses" means the reasonable expenses of expert
witnesses, the reasonable cost of any study, analysis, consultation with
experts, and like expenses, and reasonable attorney fees, including fees
for work performed by law students or paralegals under the supervision
of an attorney incurred in connection with an administrative proceeding
and judicial action.
"Final judgment" means a judgment that is final and not\nappealable, and settlement.\n

"Position of the state" means the act, acts or failure to act from\nwhich judicial review is sought.\n

"Prevailing party" means a plaintiff or petitioner in the civil
action against the state who prevails in whole or in substantial part
where such party and the state prevail upon separate issues.
"State" means the state or any of its agencies or any of its\nofficials acting in his or her official capacity.\n
